title: Dolly Parton Says She Wonâ€™t Attend Grand Ole Opry 80th Birthday Celebration in Video Message: â€˜Sending You All MyÂ Loveâ€™
summary: The Jan. 17 event will feature Lainey Wilson, Vince Gill, Rhonda Vincent and others.
body: Dolly Parton has revealed that she will not attend her 80th birthday celebration at the Grand Ole Opry. The 79-year-old country music icon, who turns 80 on Jan. 19, shared the news in a video message posted to the Opryâ€™s Instagram page on Thursday (Jan. 8). In the clip, Parton explained that she will unfortunately miss the Nashville venueâ€™s birthday show, scheduled for Jan. 17. Related Miley Cyrus Opens Up About Godmother Dolly Partonâ€™s Health: ‘The Show Must Go On’ Dolly Parton Assures Fans She’s ‘OK’ Amid Health Rumors: ‘Do I Look Sick to You?!’ Watch Dolly Parton Go Shopping for Her New ‘Star of the Show’ Book Throughout Nashville: ‘This Is Heavy!’ â€œWell, hey there Grand Ole Opry family,â€ Parton said. â€œI just wanted to say how much it means to me that youâ€™re all coming together again this year to celebrate my big olâ€™ birthday with some of my songs.â€ She continued, â€œSome of my favorite memories happened right here onstage at the Grand Ole Opry, and I wish I could be there in person, but Iâ€™ll be sending you all my love for sure. So you have the best night ever.â€ The Jan. 17 event, titled “Opry â€¦

title: Cain Culto & Xiuhtezcatlâ€™s â€˜Â¡BASTA YA!â€™ Revived as Anti-ICE Rallying Cry, Plus More Uplifting Moments in LatinÂ Music
summary: Plus, Rawayana's Beto Montenegro and business executives reflect on the future of Venezuela's music industry.
body: From career milestones to new music releases to major announcements and those little important moments,  Billboard  editors highlight uplifting moments in Latin music. Hereâ€™s what happened in the Latin music world this week. Cain Culto & Xiuhtezcatl Demand Justice With Powerful Protest Anthem Amid ongoing outrage over immigration policies and ICE raids â€” including protests this week following the fatal shooting of Renee Nicole Good by an ICE agent in Minneapolis â€” Cain Culto and Xiuhtezcatlâ€™s â€œÂ¡BASTA YA!â€ has taken on fresh urgency. Originally released in late November, the fiery bilingual track was reposted by Mexican artist Xiuhtezcatl via Instagram on Friday (Jan. 9) with a call to action. â€œWe must resist the politics of death this administration and its henchmen embody,” he wrote . “Another world is possible. Fuerza a los pueblos que resisten (strength to all the communities who resist).â€ Set against hyper piano pop beats, the song delivers bluntly powerful verses like “ Hasta sin papeles somos de la tierra ” (“Even without papers we belong to this Earth”), underscoring themes of resilience, anger, and solidarity. title: Washington National Opera Cutting Ties With Kennedy Center Following TrumpÂ Renaming
summary: Artists ranging from Lin-Manuel Miranda to Peter Wolf have recently called off events at the venue.
body: The Washington National Opera announced Friday (Jan. 9) that it will move performances away from the Kennedy Center in another high-profile departure following President Donald Trumpâ€™s takeover of the U.S. capitalâ€™s leading performing arts venue. The opera said it will seek to end its affiliation with the Kennedy Center through an â€œamicable transitionâ€ and will return to operating independently. It cited financial constraints imposed after Trump fired the Kennedy Centerâ€™s board and installed allies to oversee it. Related Why Peter Wolf Finally Got Around to Writing His Memoir (And Canceled on the Kennedy Center) Kennedy Center Board Votes to Rename Washington D.C. Landmark After President Trump Banjoist BÃ©la Fleck Pulls Out of Kennedy Center Concert The opera will reduce its spring season and move performances to other venues â€œto ensure fiscal prudence and fulfill its obligations for a balanced budget,â€ the opera said in a statement. The statement did not mention Trump or the decision by the Kennedy Centerâ€™s new board to add the presidentâ€™s name to the venue. Though Congress still formally calls it the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, the buildingâ€™s eâ€¦

title: Bandaged Dawson puts Macclesfield ahead against Palace
summary: Shortly after adjusting the bandages on his head after picking up an injury early in the match, Paul Dawson nods home Macclesfield's opener to put them ahead against Crystal Palace.

title: NFL Playoffs on Sling TV: Hereâ€™s How to Watch Rams vs. Panthers Wild Card GameÂ Online
summary: The NFC wild card game kicks off on Jan. 10 at 4:30 p.m. ET.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. The 2026 NFL playoffs start with an NFC wild card game between the Los Angeles Rams and the Carolina Panthers. Even though the Rams have a better record, the Panthers received home field advantage this round because they won the NFC South division this season. Kicking off at Bank of America Stadium in Charlotte, the Rams are hitting the road but are still the clear favorites to win with their impressive 12-5 record. However, the Panthers have home field advantage and really have nothing to lose. Carolina surprised football fans this season by just making it to the playoffs, so win or lose on Saturday, this season is still a win for the Panthers. When Does the Rams vs. Panthers Game Start ? Rams vs. Panthers game will kickoff on Jan. 10 at 4:30 p.m. ET/1:30 p.m. PT at America Stadium in Charlotte, NC. Where to Watch Rams vs. Panthers Online The NFL Wild Card game will broadcast live on FOX but can be streamed through Sling Blue or Orange . Keep scrolâ€¦

title: Seven SPFL games postponed amid weather warnings

title: Villa set to sign Chelsea's Jean-Francois
summary: Aston Villa are set to sign Chelsea and France midfielder Oriane Jean-Francois for Â£450,000.

title: Yungblud Sparks Fan Frenzy at Sydney Gallery, Goes Commando onÂ Yacht
summary: Yungbludâ€™s arrival in Australia ahead of the kickoff of his IDOLS World Tour has been anything but low-key.
body: Yungbludâ€™s arrival in Australia ahead of the kickoff of his IDOLS World Tour has been anything but low-key. The British rocker touched down in Sydney earlier this week and quickly drew massive fan attention after attending a pop-up photo gallery exhibition in Newtown, where crowds reportedly became so large that police were called to manage the situation. The event, titled Yungblud: IDOLS , featured photography by British photographer Tom Pallant and showcased images from previous legs of the singerâ€™s ongoing tour. Yungblud â€” born Dominic Harrison â€” had encouraged fans to attend the gallery via social media, telling them he would be there in person. Hundreds reportedly queued for hours to catch a glimpse of the artist, with some lining up from early morning. Though no major incidents were reported, the turnout was large enough that authorities asked the event to wrap earlier than planned. â€œYo guys, I love you so much, thank you for coming out,â€ Yungblud said in a voice memo shared to fans afterward. â€œThat got a bit fâ€”ing hectic, didnâ€™t it? The cops said we had to move on because it was just getting mad.â€ The exhibition is scheduled to run through Jan. 11, with fans lining up as eaâ€¦

title: England's Stanway to leave Bayern in summer
summary: England international Georgia Stanway will leave Bayern Munich upon the expiry of her contract at the end of the season.

title: Ye Sues Construction Worker for Messing With Malibu MansionÂ Sale
summary: The controversial rapper says a construction manager placed an invalid lien on his Malibu house, effectively discouraging buyers.
body: Ye, the rapper formerly known as Kanye West , is suing a construction manager for allegedly interfering with the sale of his $57 million Malibu house. Ye brought slander and breach of contract claims on Thursday (Jan. 8) against Tony Saxon, who handled construction work on the rapperâ€™s beachfront mansion in 2021. Notably, Saxon has been pursuing his own lawsuit against Ye since 2023 over alleged unpaid wages and unsafe working conditions on the job. Related Kanye West Sued By Ex-Employee Over Back Pay and Unsafe Working Conditions Maya J'an Signs With Warner Records: Debut Single is a Powerful 'Love Letter' to Hometown After L.A. Fires Kennedy Center President to 'Seek $1 Million in Damages' From Jazz Musician Who Called Off Christmas Eve Show To account for those alleged unpaid wages, Saxon took out a $1.8 million lien on the house after Ye put it on the market, through which Saxon claimed he would be entitled to a portion of the proceeds from any sale. Saxonâ€™s lawyer, Ronald Zambrano , told media outlets at the time, â€œIf someone wants to buy Kanyeâ€™s Malibu home, theyâ€™ll have to deal with us first.â€ â€œYe is one of the most recognizable recording artisâ€¦

title: Watch every penalty from Wrexham's FA Cup win over Forest
summary: Watch every penalty as Wrexham knocked out Premier League Nottingham Forest after a 3-3 draw in the third round of the FA Cup.

title: Wrexham's story 'written in the stars, literally'
summary: Wrexham's remarkable rise continues as they knock Premier League side Nottingham Forest out of the FA Cup in dramatic fashion.

title: Oxford beat MK Dons in FA Cup penalty shootout
summary: New Oxford United boss Matt Bloomfield watches on from the stands as his side beat MK Dons on penalties to progress to the FA Cup fourth round.

title: Final Steps Underway for NASAâ€™s First Crewed Artemis Moon Mission
summary: As NASA moves closer to launch of the Artemis II test flight, the agency soon will roll its SLS (Space Launch System) rocket and Orion spacecraft to the launch pad for the first time at the agencyâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida to begin final integration, testing, and launch rehearsals. NASA is â€¦
body: NASAâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System) rocket is seen inside High Bay 3 of the Vehicle Assembly Building as teams await the arrival of Artemis II crewmembers to board their Orion spacecraft on top of the rocket as part of the Artemis II countdown demonstration test, Saturday, Dec. 20, 2025, at NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. NASA/Joel Kowsky As NASA moves closer to launch of the Artemis II test flight, the agency soon will roll its SLS (Space Launch System) rocket and Orion spacecraft to the launch pad for the first time at the agencyâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida to begin final integration, testing, and launch rehearsals. NASA is targeting no earlier than Saturday, Jan. 17, to begin the multi-hour trek from the Vehicle Assembly Building to Launch Pad 39B. The four-mile journey on the crawler-transporter-2 will take up to 12 hours. Teams are working around the clock to close out all tasks ahead of rollout. However, this target date is subject to change if additional time is needed for technical preparations or weather. â€œ We are moving closer to Artemis II, with rollout just around the corner,â€ said Lori Glaze, acting associate administrator for NASAâ€™s Exploration Systems Devâ€¦

title: Wrexham shock Forest in shootout after six-goal thriller
summary: Watch highlights as Wrexham shock Nottingham Forest in an FA Cup third-round thriller, beating the Premier League side on penalties after a 3-3 draw.

title: 'Unacceptable to the badge' - Dyche fumes at FA Cup exit
summary: Sean Dyche calls for some of his Nottingham Forest players to "have a look in the mirror" after an "unacceptable" first-half performance in their FA Cup loss at Wrexham on penalties.

title: Shipley goal helps Port Vale past Fleetwood
summary: Jordan Shipley scores the only goal to put Port Vale into the fourth round of the FA Cup at the expense of Fleetwood Town.

title: Wigan survive late scare to beat Preston in Lancashire derby
summary: Harrison Bettoni's lone goal seals a narrow victory for League One side Wigan Athletic, as Brad Potts' injury time equaliser for Preston North End is ruled out for offside.

title: O'Sullivan withdraws from Masters for medical reasons
summary: Eight-time champion Ronnie O'Sullivan withdraws from the Masters, which starts on Sunday, for the second year in a row on medical grounds.

title: Chukwuemeka secures stoppage-time point for Dortmund against Frankfurt
summary: Carney Chukwuemeka scores the second of two stoppage-time goals to bring Borussia Dortmund level with Eintracht Frankfurt, in a thrilling six-goal Bundesliga game.

title: Young Chelsea can be new Class of '92 - Rosenior
summary: Chelsea's young squad has the potential to grow and deliver trophies like Manchester United's famous Class of '92 side, new boss Liam Rosenior believes.

title: Henderson's stunning double as Ross County beat Thistle

title: Shaken, Not Stirred: NASAâ€™s StarBurst Aces Extreme Temperature Tests
summary: Heated, cooled, shaken, and settled â€“ NASAâ€™s StarBurst instrument is several steps closer to being ready for launch. The small satellite is now awaiting instrument calibration following a successful integration in Canada and rigorous testing by engineers at the agencyâ€™s Marshall Space Flight Centerâ€¦
body: NASAâ€™s StarBurst instrument outside a thermal vacuum chamber at NASAâ€™s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. NASA/Daniel Kocevski Heated, cooled, shaken, and settled â€“ NASA’s StarBurst instrument is several steps closer to being ready for launch. The small satellite is now awaiting instrument calibration following a successful integration in Canada and rigorous testing by engineers at the agencyâ€™s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. StarBurst is designed to detect the initial emission of short gamma-ray bursts, some of the most powerful explosions in the universe and a key indicator of neutron star mergers. This would provide valuable insight into such events, which are also detected through gravitational waves by observatories on Earth. These events are where most of the heavy metals in the universe, such as gold and platinum, are formed. To date, only one such event has been observed simultaneously in gravitational waves and gamma-rays; StarBurst is expected to find up to 10 per year. StarBurst arrived at NASA Marshall in March 2025. During its time at the center, the instrument underwent thermal testing in a vacuum chamber and flight vibratâ€¦

title: Flight Engineers Give NASAâ€™s Dragonfly Lift
summary: In sending a car-sized rotorcraft to explore Saturnâ€™s moon Titan, NASAâ€™s Dragonfly mission will undertake an unprecedented voyage of scientific discovery. And the work to ensure that this first-of-its-kind project can fulfill its ambitious exploration vision is underway in some of the nationâ€™s mostâ€¦
body: In sending a car-sized rotorcraft to explore Saturnâ€™s moon Titan, NASAâ€™s Dragonfly mission will undertake an unprecedented voyage of scientific discovery. And the work to ensure that this first-of-its-kind project can fulfill its ambitious exploration vision is underway in some of the nationâ€™s most advanced space simulation and testing laboratories. From left, Johns Hopkins APL engineers Tyler Radomsky and Felipe Ruiz install a rotor on the Dragonfly test model at the Transonic Dynamics Tunnel at NASAâ€™s Langley Research Center in Virginia. NASA Set for launch in in 2028, the Dragonfly rotorcraft is being designed and built at the Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) in Laurel, Maryland, with contributions from organizations around the world. On arrival in 2034, Dragonfly will exploit Titan’s dense atmosphere and low gravity to fly to dozens of locations, exploring varied environments from organic equatorial dunes to an impact crater where liquid water and complex organic materials essential to life (at least as we know it) may have existed together. Aerodynamic testing When full rotorcraft integration and testing begins in February, the team will tap into a trove oâ€¦

title: I Am Artemis: Dave Reynolds
summary: As booster manager for NASAâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System), Dave Reynoldsâ€™ path to NASA is embodied by his childhood poster of the space shuttleâ€™s Return to Flight initiative, which hangs in his office, serving as a constant reminder that his journey to the agency began decades ago. Growing up in Roy,â€¦
body: 3 Min Read I Am Artemis: Dave Reynolds Dave Reynolds, the booster manager for SLS (Space Launch System), works inside the Next Generation Booster Avionics Mockup at NASAâ€™s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. Reynolds is responsible for the design, development, and flight of the boosters for the rocket that carry NASAâ€™s Orion spacecraft and astronauts to the Moon as part of the Artemis II mission. Credits: NASA As booster manager for NASAâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System), Dave Reynoldsâ€™ path to NASA is embodied by his childhood poster of the space shuttleâ€™s Return to Flight initiative, which hangs in his office, serving as a constant reminder that his journey to the agency began decades ago. Growing up in Roy, Utah, Reynolds remembers standing outside to watch the billowing smoke rise from booster tests at Northrop Grummanâ€™s Promontory facility. Rockets were the backdrop of his childhood, and growing up during the shuttle missions sparked his fascination for space exploration. As the booster manager for the SLS, Dave is responsible for the design, development, and flight of the boostersâ€”work that echoes the sense of significance that inspired him as a child to study spaâ€¦

body: 6 min read NASAâ€™s Pandora Satellite, CubeSats to Explore Exoplanets, Beyond A new NASA spacecraft called Pandora is awaiting launch ahead of its journey to study the atmospheres of exoplanets, or worlds beyond our solar system, and their stars. Along for the ride are two shoebox-sized satellites called BlackCAT (Black Hole Coded Aperture Telescope) and SPARCS (Star-Planet Activity Research CubeSat) , as NASA innovates with ambitious science missions that take low-cost, creative approaches to answering questions like, â€œHow does the universe work?â€ and â€œAre we alone?â€ All three missions are set to launch Jan. 11 on a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket from Space Launch Complex 4 East at Vandenberg Space Force Base in California. The launch window opens at 8:19 a.m. EST (5:19 a.m. PST). SpaceX will livestream the event. Artistâ€™s concept of NASAâ€™s Pandora mission, which will help scientists untangle the signals from the atmospheres of exoplanets â€” worlds beyond our solar system â€” and their stars. NASAâ€™s Goddard Space Flight Center/Conceptual Image Lab Download high-resolution images from NASA’s Scientific Visualization Studio â€œPandoraâ€™s goal is to disentangle the atmospheric signals of planâ€¦

This image shows low-lying clouds over the delta on the morning of January 6, captured by the MODIS (Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer) on NASAâ€™s Terra satellite. Dense fog, particularly radiation fog , is common this time of year, forming when ground temperatures are cool, winds are light, and moisture is abundant near the surface. summary: NASA will host a live news conference at 5 p.m. EST on Thursday from the agencyâ€™s headquarters in Washington to discuss the International Space Station and its crew. body: Credit: NASA NASA will host a live news conference at 5 p.m. EST on Thursday from the agencyâ€™s headquarters in Washington to discuss the International Space Station and its crew. On Jan. 7, the agency announced it was postponing a planned spacewalk originally scheduled for Jan. 8 while teams monitored a medical concern with a crew member currently living and working aboard the orbital laboratory. The matter involved a single crew member, who is stable . Due to medical privacy, it is not appropriate for NASA to share more details about the crew member. Participants in the news conference include: NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman Amit Kshatriya, associate administrator Dr. James Polk, chief health and medical officer, NASA Headquarters NASA will provide live coverage of the news conference on NASA+ , Amazon Prime , and the agencyâ€™s YouTube channel . Learn how to stream NASA content through a variety of online platforms, including social media. To participate in the news conference virtually or in-person, media must RSVP for details no later than one hour before the start of the event to the NASA Newsroom at: hq-media@mail.nasa.gov . NASAâ€™s media credentialing policy is online. To lâ€¦

title: NASA Starts Up Gatewayâ€™s Power System for First Time
summary: Development continues on NASAâ€™s Power and Propulsion Element, a solar electric propulsion spacecraft designed to provide power for Gateway in lunar orbit. Able to generate 60 kilowatts of power, the element was successfully powered on earlier last year. The milestone demonstrates the element can prâ€¦
body: 1 min read Preparations for Next Moonwalk Simulations Underway (and Underwater) The primary structure of Gatewayâ€™s Power and Propulsion Element (PPE) undergoing assembly, integration, and testing at Lanteris Space Systems in Palo Alto, California, on September 29, 2025. Lanteris Space Systems Development continues on NASAâ€™s Power and Propulsion Element, a solar electric propulsion spacecraft designed to provide power for Gateway in lunar orbit. Able to generate 60 kilowatts of power, the element was successfully powered on earlier last year. The milestone demonstrates the element can provide the spacecraft with power, high-rate communications, attitude control, as well as the ability to maintain and maneuver between orbits. The Power and Propulsion Element is managed by NASAâ€™s Glenn Research Center in Cleveland and built by industry partner Lanteris Space Systems in Palo Alto, California, where teams have secured the elementâ€™s main electrical system inside protective exterior panels. On deck for installation at Lanteris Space Systems are three 12-kilowatt advanced electric propulsion system thrusters, manufactured by L3Harris, and four 6-kilowatt Busek-built BHT-6000 thrusters. title: Meltwater Turns Iceberg A-23A Blue
summary: After a four-decade run, the massive, waterlogged berg is leaking meltwater and on the verge of disintegrating.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Meltwater Turns Iceberg A-23Aâ€¦ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Search Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe ğŸ›œ RSS Contact Us December 26, 2025 The year that iceberg A-23A first broke away from Antarcticaâ€™s Filchner Ice Shelf , Ronald Reagan was president of the United States, and the movie Top Gun was setting box office records. Forty years later, the massive tabular bergâ€”one of the largest and longest-lived bergs ever tracked by scientistsâ€”is sopping with blue meltwater and on the verge of complete disintegration as it drifts in the South Atlantic between the eastern tip of South America and South Georgia island. When it first detached from Antarctica in 1986, the berg was nearly twice the size of Rhode Islandâ€”about 4,000 square kilometers. Estimates from the U.S. National Ice Center put the bergâ€™s area at 1,182 squaâ€¦
